abstract: Cholesterol-lowering drug Praluent, developed by Sanofi and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals, is extraordinarily powerful 'game changer' in fight against LDL cholesterol for nearly a million Americans with inherited condition that causes resistance to cholesterol-lowering statins; extremely high cost of Praluent, nearly $14,600 a year, is causing insurance companies to set stringent requirements for its use.
lead_paragraph: About a million Americans have an inherited condition that defies cholesterol-lowering statins. Even at $14,600 a year, a new drug provides hope.

headline.main: Praluent Looks Cheap to Those With Extreme Cholesterol
headline.print_headline: When $14,600 for a Drug Looks Cheap

snippet: About a million Americans have an inherited condition that defies cholesterol-lowering statins. Even at $14,600 a year, a new drug provides hope.
